page.title: 10Bird Reserve, Lound (part 2)
page.content: there. The largest bird is a Trumpeter Swan and the smallest is the Hottentot Teal but the mallards are the most numerous. The Flamingoes are fed a diet which includes vitamins and prawns to retain their colour. Feeding the birds twice a day costs Â£4,ooo a year but they have problems in winter when large numbers of Canada Geese and Coots fly in. Injured birds are brought to the Park and lO to l5 are treated each year. There are 7 to 8 thousand visitors each year who pay Â£l.2O for entry (6Op for children and old aged pensioners. The park is open every day, except Christmas, from lO a.m. to 6.p.m. (9 p.m. Thursdays).
